definition: (old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax

sentences.english: At the turn of the Ming and Qing Dynasties, because transportation prosperity brought Liaocheng cultural development.
sentences.chinese: 明清之交，由于漕运兴盛带来了聊城文化事业的发展。

sentences.english: The orderly management of canal transportation provided the prerequisite to the economic prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 漕运的有序管理，为经济的繁荣发展提供了前提条件。

sentences.english: Sea-freight is the main manner of water transportation in Yuan Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 海运是元代漕运的主要方式。

sentences.english: Due to its grain transport functions, the Chiang-hsi wei-so lingered on into the Ch'ing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 入清以后，江西卫所因为漕运功能而残存下来。

definition: government revenue/tributary goods and finances/finances and taxes/wealth/property/belongings
the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
a form of transit taxation in China introduced to finance armies to suppress the Taiping Rebellion
Hubei and Hunan provinces (a Ming dynasty province)
Gyeonggi Province, South Korea, surrounding Seoul and Incheon, capital Suweon City 水原市[Shui3 yuan2 shi4]
capital city and its surrounding area
river conservancy works (dike maintenance, dredging etc)/river conservancy worker
